If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Blocked from attempting) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @joekaufmanexpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Convert](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1764604325203019) ## Action Performed: 1. Add a direct or Plaid card feed 2. Break the feed's connection 3. Go to the company cards page 4. Go to Wallet page 5. Go to #admins room ## Expected Result: At step 3, we should show an error message on the broken feed that prompts the admin to reconnect it. This is broken now. At step 4, we should show an error message that explains the card has a broken connection and an admin can resolve it. This is broken now. At step 5, we should display a message from concierge in #admins room explaining the company card connection is broken and link to the feed to fix it. ## Actual Result: At step 3, we show a red dot error on the feed with no message. At step 4, we show a red dot error on the card on wallet with no message. At step 5, we currently don't notify in the #admins room when a card feed connection breaks. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

body:
In this PR https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/73672 we allowed translations to not need a new type per translation.

What we want to do now is:
- Remove all existing types that are only used in translations 
- Ensure we always pass the params as standalone params instead of inside an object (like we did in [this comment](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/73672/commits/257802ef77b55c7f3f5e741c25052f7b500a96c2))

title: [$250] Eliminate UI Jank on Search Page Filtering

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from a proposal [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1764596907122559) ### Background: The Search page is the primary tool for accountants and admins to view, filter, and manage large volumes of transaction data. Users frequently interact with this page by toggling filters (e.g., changing status from “all” to “approved”) or selecting multiple items for bulk action. These lists often contain nested transaction groups (e.g., expense reports containing multiple individual expenses), requiring the interface to render complex data structures rapidly to maintain a fluid user experience. ### Problem: When a user viewing a large number of results on the Search page changes a filter or selects an item, the main JavaScript thread blocks for ~1.2 seconds, causing the UI to freeze and become unresponsive. ### Solution: The Search list rendering logic is refactored to decouple selection state from the data mapping process. Selection logic is moved out of the heavy, memoized data-sorting function and into the lighter render phase. Specifically, selectedTransactions is removed from the main useMemo dependencies, and a “fast path” iterator is implemented to skip unnecessary nested loops for unselected items. This ensures that interacting with filters or checkboxes only triggers a visual update for the relevant rows, rather than a full recalculation of the entire list. Draft PR: https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/76339

title: [$250] Remove Modal-Triggered Rerenders from Hoverable

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from Slack [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1764326614475289) ### Background Hoverable is a cross-app component responsible for changing an element’s background on pointer hover (web-only feature, native platforms don't use it). It is used broadly across the product, including in lists, banners, and video controls. Many features also rely on modals (such as search, confirmations, and right-hand panels) whose visibility state is stored in Onyx. Every time a modal opens or closes, the associated Onyx modal key updates. Hoverable currently depends on the modal key. ### Problem When a modal’s visibility state changes in Onyx, every Hoverable instance rerenders unnecessarily. ### Solution Instead of subscribing Hoverable to the modal’s Onyx key, we pass an explicit isFocused prop to indicate whether the screen containing the Hoverable is currently active ([draft PR](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/76216)) This replaces the original intent of the modal dependency (clearing hover state on the search page when [renaming a saved search](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/66845)) while eliminating global rerenders triggered by unrelated modal activity. Implementation steps: 1. Remove dependency on the modal Onyx key from Hoverable. 2. Add an isFocused prop to Hoverable. 3. In lists that require clearing the hover state (MenuItemList), set isFocused based on navigation focus. This ensures Hoverable only rerenders when its own screen context changes, not when any modal in the app updates. ### Impact This change affects the entire app, given the broad use of Hoverable. Localised testing demonstrates significant performance gains: Opening the search modal on a report screen with ~80 report actions (larger lists amplify the effect): - Before: - Total: 776ms - Hoverable: 285ms - After: - Total: 623ms (20% faster) - Hoverable: 16ms (95% reduction)

title: Eliminating Redundant Onyx Subscriptions

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from a proposal [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1764249059104699)

### Background
The ReportActionItemSingle component is responsible for rendering individual rows within a chat report, often appearing in lists containing hundreds of items. To properly display avatars for IOU previews (money requests), the system must determine a "sender ID" using complex logic that aggregates data from Onyx collections. Currently, the useReportPreviewSenderID hook establishes these subscriptions and performs these calculations for every single item in the list, and this hook is effectively invoked in parallel with useReportActionAvatars, which manages similar avatar logic.

### Problem
When a user scrolls through a report containing many actions, if the system renders ReportActionItemSingle components, then it triggers duplicate heavy calculations and initializes unnecessary Onyx subscriptions for data that is often irrelevant (specifically for optimistic actions or duplicate calls), resulting in measurable frame drops and excessive memory consumption.

### Solution
1. Remove duplicate useReportPreviewSenderID call from ReportActionItemSingle.
2. Inside useReportActionAvatars return reportPreviewSenderID and use it in ReportActionItemSingle
3. Pass undefined to Onyx keys when action is optimistic to prevent unnecessary subscriptions.
4. Add early returns in useReportPreviewSenderID after checking amount signs and attendee count.

[Draft PR](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/76010)
Performance scripting time:
- chat with a lot items: scripting time reduced from 2,463ms to 1900ms
- chat with just 3 items, little scroll: scripting time almost the same 249ms to 237ms
- medium size chat: scripting time reduced from 790ms to 680ms

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @akinwale</details>

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @BartekObudzinski</details>

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.66-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2221/folder/13176923/53628502/1045231897 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2139@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. Prerequisite 2: Delayed submissions and approvals enabled. 1. Open the staging.new.expensify.com website. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Create a manual expense. 4. Submit and approve the expense. 5. Navigate to "Reports" > "Pay" 6. Turn off internet connection. 7. Open the just created expense report. 8. Mark the expense as paid. 9. Note that after expense is paid, all the report becomes grayed out. 10. Navigate to workspace chat again. 11. Reopen expense report. 12. Note that report is not grayed out if opened on chat. ## Expected Result: When an expense is paid while in offline mode, only the system message received after the action, should be displayed grayed out. ## Actual Result: When an expense is paid while in offline mode in "Reports" section, the entire report becomes grayed out and not only the received system message. Report is not displayed grayed out if opened from chat or if it is paid while offline in chat. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6ff9a042-5ab1-4adb-9752-db4e56a901d7 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit
